stories.title: Show HN: A freelancer invoicing app that includes tracking time/tasks

stories.text:
For all our client and server interactions (APIS) - we are just using websockets. It is a gaming application.

Its a proof of concept used by close to ~50 people. The application feels snappy compared to say our previous REST API implementation. But of course we've not built for scale.

Now, we want to build a scalable version of it. Are there inherent limitations on why people aren't using websocket for APIs instead of REST APIs ?
stories.title: Ask HN: WebSocket APIs vs. REST APIs – will it make a difference?

stories.text: ChamberCoupon is an American-based marketing company that offers coupons and promo codes for premium brands. Discounts and sale events are of tremendous importance for brands, especially during festive seasons and holidays.
